subject: Software Deadzone issue
description_text:
Hey,

When i set deadzones in the software how i want, like 5% bottom deadzone on the brake,  it doesnt behave the same in games.
In game its about half of that and input comes sooner in game than it shows in the software.

DIview software(with this its easy to see actual % difference vs your software %), Le mans Ultimate, ACC, all behaves the same.

I have to work around this by applying 10% deadzone instead of 5% to software or apply additional deadzone in game to get about the same results/feeling.

Same with the Gas pedal.
I want 2% bottom and 3% top deadzones in software, but to get same results in game i will have to double those to 4% and 6%.

So there might be a bug on your software or is there something i can do to fix that?

Otherwise very happy with the pedals!

Ps.
Also when setting deadzone in the software and looking brake KGs when input start, it changes slightly after i hit "save".
This is not as big deal, but thought you should know.

Like if my deadzone is 5% with 50kg, before i hit save, input starts to come after like 4.5kg or so, but after i hit "save", the force needed is lower like 3.5-.

-Keijo Vinni


LähetettyOutlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>

conversations.body_text: Hi Keijo Vinni,          Please click Offset in the software to reset the pedal’s white signal to 0%, then recalibrate the pedals.

Hey,

Did that multiple times today.
Still behaves always the same.

I need to put 2x deadzone to software that pedals behave about the same in game than with initial deadzone i would want if i just look software.

I use medium yellow rubbers, 50kg.
If i put 5% deadzone in software, input comes around under 4kg in software but sooner around 2kg in game/DIview.
I up deadzone to 10% and then input comes in software after 8kg, but in game/DIview after 5kg and this is my workaround right now.

Throttle also behaves the same.

-Keijo Vinni
